Column Comment.0: UWI: Unique well identifier for a well.
Column Comment.1: DRILLING REPORT IDENTIFIER: Well drilling reports are often prepared andprovided as summaries that cover one or more tours or shifts. All the tours (shifts)contained in a report must be for the same well. Reports for different wells should becaptured as different reports.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: CONTRACTOR BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for thecompany who is the contractor for the well at the time the report was prepared.
Column Comment.4: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.5: END DATE: The last date that this well drilling report covers in full or in part. Timecomponent is captured in END TIME.
Column Comment.6: END TIME: The last time that this well drilling report covers. Date component iscaptured in END DATE.
Column Comment.7: TIMEZONE: a valid list of time zones. You can obtain a list of timezones fromwww.worldtimezone.com.
Column Comment.8: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.9: FILE DATE: The date that the file was created, usually the electronic version fromwhich the database was loaded.
Column Comment.10: FILE TIME: The time that the file was created, usually the electronic version fromwhich the database was loaded
Column Comment.11: TIMEZONE: a valid list of time zones. You can obtain a list of timezones fromwww.worldtimezone.com.
Column Comment.12: PERIOD COUNT: The number of periods, usually referred to as shifts, tours orreporting periods that are included in this report.
Column Comment.13: PERIOD DURATION: The duration of each period in this report. Usually 8, 12 or 24hours.
Column Comment.15: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.16: RECORD COUNT: The number of records in this well drilling report. This maycorrespond to the number of ETS records in the ETS Tour sheet specification, and isavailable to verify that the original ETS sheets can be correctly replicated as needed.
Column Comment.17: REFERENCE NUMBER: A documented reference number by which this report isidentified, such as the serial number of the report.
Column Comment.18: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.19: REPORTED CONTRACTOR NAME: the name of the contractor company asreported on the report. You may also add a validated key to via the CONTRACTORBA ID.
Column Comment.20: REPORTED RIG NUMBER: The rig number reported on the daily or shift basedreports.
Column Comment.21: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.22: DIGITAL FORMAT: The format in which the original report was received, and fromwhich the details have been extracted for the data model. In North America, the mostcommonly used format is the Canadian Association of Oilwell Drilling ContractorsElectronic Tour Sheet.
Column Comment.23: START DATE: The first date that this well drilling report covers in full or in part. Timecomponent is captured in START TIME.
Column Comment.24: START TIME: The first time that this well drilling report covers. Date component iscaptured in START DATE.
Column Comment.25: TIMEZONE: a valid list of time zones. You can obtain a list of timezones fromwww.worldtimezone.com.
Column Comment.26: APPLICATION NAME: The unique name of an application that was used to generatethe report.
Column Comment.27: VENDOR DIGITAL FORMAT: The digital format used by the vendor to record theoriginal data, often a variation of the standard version.
Column Comment.28: VERSION SEQUENCE NUMBER: a sequence number indicating what version of thereport this is. The first version is typically version 1, with newer version assigned thenext available number.
Column Comment.29: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.30: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.31: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.32: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.33: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.34: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.35: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
